fields.summary: ILL: Evaluate AutoScaling limits on AutoScalingGroup

fields.description:
When an auto scaling group has instances it can be deleted along with those instances by using the force option for the delete action. If the account for the group has been deleted and the owner information has expired from the cache then it is not possible to delete the account:

{code}
#
# euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group -d arn:aws:autoscaling::000645637062:autoScalingGroup:4f0db28d-1e27-4dcf-aae0-e126c2d04f3a:autoScalingGroupName/group-1
euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group: error (ResourceInUse): Resource in use
#
#
{code}

It is possible to set the desired capacity for the group to zero, but instances will not be terminated and the following error can be seen in the cloud-error.log:

{code}
Mon Aug 24 17:26:03 2015 ERROR [ActivityManager:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:ListenerRegistry:listenerTasks.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#596] [com.eucalyptus.autoscaling.activities.ActivityManager.transitionToDeregistered(ActivityManager.java):995] com.eucalyptus.autoscaling.metadata.AutoScalingMetadataException: Failed to find auto scaling instances by example: [AutoScalingInstance availabilityZone=null healthStatus=null autoScalingGroup=null autoScalingGroupName=group-1 launchConfigurationName=null lifecycleState=null inServiceTimestamp=null configurationState=Registered registrationAttempts=null displayName=null ownerAccountNumber=000000000000 uniqueName=null ownerFullNameCached=null ownerUserId=null ownerUserName=null id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]

        at com.eucalyptus.autoscaling.instances.PersistenceAutoScalingInstances$4.doWork(PersistenceAutoScalingInstances.java:282)

fields.summary: Auto scaling unable to delete autoscaling group after owning account deleted

comments.body: Deleting an autoscaling group or setting the desired capacity to zero now work after the owning account has been deleted.

Steps to verify the issue:

{code}
#
#
# euare-accountcreate -a test-account
test-account	000222863185
# 
# 
# 
# euare-useraddkey --as-account test-account -u admin
AKIAASLT26CPK2BB3EAF
PCK6IBNAiWEErK36gXQeUokAYsHw5IFmXNqQ97AL
# 
# 
# euca-describe-images -I AKIAASLT26CPK2BB3EAF -S PCK6IBNAiWEErK36gXQeUokAYsHw5IFmXNqQ97AL -a
IMAGE	emi-481a0eea	cirros-2014-06-17/cirros-2014-06-17.raw.manifest.xml	000045578656	available	public	x86_64	machine				instance-store	hvm	
# 
# 
# euscale-create-launch-config -i emi-481a0eea -t m1.small config-1
# 
# 
# euscale-create-auto-scaling-group -l config-1 -m 0 -M 0 -z one group-1
# 
# 
# euare-accountdel -r test-account
# 
# 
# # clear cached user information so we don't have to wait for expiry
# euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.auth.principal.UserFullName.userIdMap.invalidateAll()'
warning: euca-modify-property is deprecated; use ``euctl'' instead
PROPERTY	euca	null was executed successfully.
# 
# 
# # describe all groups with ARN and find the test group
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups verbose --show-long
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	group-1	config-1	one	2015-10-08T18:05:29.498Z		EC2	0	0	0	300	0			arn:aws:autoscaling::000045578656:autoScalingGroup:2b23131d-3701-4b2f-8313-5976848c2750:autoScalingGroupName/group-1	Default
# 
# 
# # delete using the ARN
# euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group arn:aws:autoscaling::000045578656:autoScalingGroup:2b23131d-3701-4b2f-8313-5976848c2750:autoScalingGroupName/group-1
# 
# 
# # verify that the group was deleted
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups verbose --show-long
# 
# 
{code}

Fix Verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.2.0
Release     : 0.0.23811.624.20150904git70f06d8.el6

Was able to delete scaling group of account that was deleted. I used the steps provided, however, I think they missed that the scaling group needed to belong to the account that is to be deleted so when creating LC and ASG I used script key and accesskey of the account.

{code}
[root@scale-02-01-01 ~]# euscale-create-launch-config -I AKIAAXXONIWD2WDXNDXB -S POKWj0bGLYzDs8Gh9N9Qgc1o8c0JjRELRZzs5vFU -i emi-1b092d83 -t m1.small config-1
[root@scale-02-01-01 ~]# euscale-create-auto-scaling-group -I AKIAAXXONIWD2WDXNDXB -S POKWj0bGLYzDs8Gh9N9Qgc1o8c0JjRELRZzs5vFU -l config-1 -m 0 -M 0 -z one group-1
{code}

After account was deleted I got all ASGs and deleted the scaling group of the account that was no more using the arn.
{code}
[root@scale-02-01-01 ~]# euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group arn:aws:autoscaling::000051840212:autoScalingGroup:b53a1253-53c3-4091-9080-bd0f0183118b:autoScalingGroupName/group-1
{code}

Than verified that the scaling group had been deleted.
